Modules.Name: Applications of Machine Learning in Medicine
Modules.NameEnglish: Applications of Machine Learning in Medicine
Modules.PrerequisiteNote:
This is a block module which happens at the end of the Semester. Therefore, it can be taken in the same semester as ADML (which is a prerequisite).

Dies ist ein Blockmodul, das am Ende des Semesters stattfindet. Daher kann es im selben Semester wie ADML (die Voraussetzung ist) belegt werden.
Modules.ComplementaryModules:
CVAI provides additional background in image analysis, TA.MED_BILDVER presents how medical imaging works, and MEDIMG discusses machine-learning modelling for medical image analysis specifically.
Ethical aspects of medical technologies are addressed in TA.MED_SKE. Interpretability methods are discussed in depth in XAI.

Andere Studiengänge:

Der Stoff der kaufmännischen Berufsmaturität wird vorausgesetzt.

Ein erster Einblick in den digitalen Begleitkurs:
https://education.doandbe.ch/mathe-digital/info

Weitere Möglichkeiten:
Selbstevaluation ganz unten auf der verlinkten Seite:
https://www.hslu.ch/de-ch/wirtschaft/studium/bachelor/business-administration/zulassung/#vorbereitungskurse
Selbstständige Repetition: https://emath.hslu.ch/ → Vorkenntnisse Berufsmatura:
https://emath.hslu.ch/functions/index.php?target=crs_de_90_Vorkenntnisse%20Berufsmatura

Modules.Name: Machine Learning
Modules.PrerequisiteNote:
Students are expected to have already studied math and programming and to be strong at both subjects (details below). However, because this module is open to so many study programs, we do not name specific modules you have to take. Instead, subject competences are listed as module requirements, the acquisition of which students can achieve by attending modules or through self-study. Sufficient qualification is the responsibility of the students themselves. If you have any questions, we are happy to offer individual advice. These are the required competencies:
 
Linear Algebra
+ Vectors, position vectors, vector operations
+ Matrices as linear mappings; matrix operations
+ Vector norm, scalar product and its interpretation as projection
+ Cosine formula for determining the angle between vectors
+ Determination and interpretation of eigenvectors and eigenvalues
 
Analysis
+ Functions in one and more variables
+ Continuous and convex functions
+ Partial derivatives and gradient
+ Visualisation e.g. contour plots
+ Local and global minima and maxima
 
Statistics
+ Mean, median, variance and standard deviation
+ Population vs. sample, Bessel correction
+ Covariance matrix
+ Normal distribution
Modules.ComplementaryModules: The Data Science profile in the MSE Master's programme offers advanced Machine Learning modules. The Bachelor's programme AIML also offers advanced modules in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and Reinforcement Learning, which build on this lecture. The Artificial Intelligence - Search & Optimization (AISO) module in the Bachelor of Computer Science is complementary. Deep Learning for Games (DL4G) is also recommended as an application.

Modules.Name: Web-Technologien
Modules.PrerequisiteNote: Achtung: Dieses Modul setzt die Fähigkeit voraus, kleinere Programme in einer der gängigen Programmiersprachen (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, C#, Python, etc.) schreiben und verstehen zu können.

Modules.Name: Advanced Machine Learning
Modules.PrerequisiteNote:
Students are expected to have already studied math and programming and to be strong at both subjects (details below). However, because this module is open to so many study programs, we do not name specific modules you have to take. Instead, subject competences are listed as module requirements, the acquisition of which students can achieve by attending modules or through self-study. Sufficient qualification is the responsibility of the students themselves. If you have any questions, we are happy to offer individual advice. These are the required competencies:
 
Linear Algebra
+ Vectors, position vectors, vector operations
+ Matrices as linear mappings; matrix operations
+ Vector norm, scalar product and its interpretation as projection
+ Cosine formula for determining the angle between vectors
+ Determination and interpretation of eigenvectors and eigenvalues
 
Analysis
+ Functions in one and more variables
+ Continuous and convex functions
+ Partial derivatives and gradient
+ Visualisation e.g. contour plots
+ Local and global minima and maxima
 
Statistics
+ Mean, median, variance and standard deviation
+ Population vs. sample, Bessel correction
+ Covariance matrix
+ Normal distribution
Modules.ComplementaryModules: The Data Science profile in the MSE Master's programme offers advanced Machine Learning modules. The Bachelor's programme AIML also offers advanced modules in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and Reinforcement Learning, which build on this lecture. The AI - Search & Optimization (AISO) and Deep Learning for Games (DL4G) modules are complementary.

Die entsprechenden Unterlagen sind beim Modulverantwortlichen, josef.schuler@hslu.ch, erhältlich, resp. sind in Ilias hochgeladen. Die relevanten Teile von D-MATH werden in einer Präsenz im Modul in einem zügigen Tempo repetiert.

Die Module BPRAXIS_1 bis _3 sind aufbauend organisiert. Der Einstieg ist aber auch bei _2 oder _3 direkt möglich. Wer plant mehrere BPRAXIS-Module zu absolvieren sollte bei _1 starten. Wer nur eines (bzw. das letzte Mal ein BPRAXIS-Modul absolviert) kann auch direkt das _3 absolvieren.
